text:
Number increased from 58,000 in 2009 to around 1.04 lakh in 2015

More ticket counters and rest shelters have been opened at the zoo —FIle Photo

The Arignar Anna Zoological Park at Vandalur is gearing up to tackle the annual Pongal rush between January 14 and 16.

There has been a steady rise in visitors to the zoo during this season, with the number increasing from 58,000 in 2009 to around 1.04 lakh in 2015.

A meeting of officials from the Departments of Forests, Public Health, Municipal Administration and Water Supply, Police, Fire and Rescue Services and Electricity was held at Vandalur on Wednesday. Twenty additional ticket counters had been opened, the officials said. A dozen additional rest shelters and an equal number of small food courts would be set up. Plastic bags had been banned, officials said, adding that the zoo would open at 7 a.m. and closed at 6 p.m.

MTC officials said that additional services from all areas of the city would be operated, said K.S.V.V.P. Reddy, zoo director. “Additional attractions this year are a pair of king cobras received from Dr. Shivarama Karanth Biological Park at Pilikula, Karnataka, and the four newborn tiger cubs that can be viewed on a big-screen television,” Mr. Reddy said.

Spread over 1,265 acres with 2,553 species of flora and fauna, the zoo is also home to 46 endangered animals of the Western Ghats and the Indian subcontinent.
title: Vandalur zoo prepares for visitors’ rush during Pongal
